mesa 0.2.1
  • Reference

    This function edits the getPCA function from qsea to allow for batch effect correction

    getPCAwithBatch.Rd

    This function edits the getPCA function from qsea to allow for batch effect correction

    getPCAwithBatch(
  qs,
  chr = qsea::getChrNames(qs),
  minRowSum = 20,
  minEnrichment = 3,
  keep,
  normMethod = "beta",
  topVar = 1000,
  samples = qsea::getSampleNames(qs),
  batchVariable = NULL
)

    Arguments

    qs

    A qseaSet object

    chr

    Which chromosomes to use

    minRowSum

    Minimum number of reads in a window across all the samples to keep it

    minEnrichment

    Minimal number of expected reads for a fully methylated window (for transformation to absolute methylation level)

    keep

    a vector of row indices to keep (optional)

    normMethod

    What normalisation method to use

    topVar

    Number of most variable windows to keep

    samples

    Which samples to use

    batchVariable

    A variable in the sampleTable to batch correct for, using limma::removeBatchEffect

    Contents

    Developed by Simon Pearce, Steven Hill.
